Legal_Issue: Whether the Visa Officer erred by not personally interviewing the applicant as required by section 11.1(b) of the former Regulations
Governing_Law: Section 11.1(b) of the former Immigration Regulations
Application_Facts: The interviewing officer was not a visa officer, violating the statutory requirement
Decision_Outcome: Application for judicial review allowed, decision quashed, case remitted for redetermination
Court_Ruling: Decision quashed and case remitted for reassessment by another visa officer
Defendant_Behavior: Failure to conduct a personal interview by a visa officer as required
Grounds_for_Claim: Improper process in refusal of Mr. Qin's application
Procedural_Issue: Lack of personal interview by authorized visa officer
Review_Standard: Reasonableness or correctness, depending on legal interpretation
Legal_Provision_Cited: Section 11.1(b) of the former Immigration Regulations
Governing_Rule: Visa officers must personally interview entrepreneur applicants
Harm_Assessment: Applicant denied fair process in immigration determination
Cause_Description: Mr. Qin's application for permanent residence was refused based on an improper process
Legal_Provision_Violated: Section 11.1(b) of the former Immigration Regulations
Decision_Rationale: Statutory requirement for personal interview by visa officer not met
